wikipedia_page.main: John Charles Halland How OGS (16 September 1881 – 22 May 1961) was a Anglican bishop. His son is the composer and organist Martin How.

link_mentions.page: Primus of the Scottish Episcopal Church

response: * John How (bishop), attended 1894–1899, Bishop of Glasgow and Primus of the Church of Scotland. In the 1930s, he was Chaplain to George V, Edward VIII and later George VI.

Martin John Richard How  (born 1931) is a British composer and organist. His father was John How, who served as Bishop of Glasgow and Galloway from 1938 to 1952 and was Primus of the Scottish Episcopal Church from 1946 to 1952.
John How (1813January 3, 1885) was the 14th mayor of St. Louis, Missouri, US, serving from 1853 to 1855 and again from 1856 to 1857.
* John How at the St. Louis Public Library: St. Louis Mayors website.
